High Order Decomposition sub Functions¶

Created on Thu May 3 10:30:18 2018

@author: Diego Britez

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.final_arrange(W, index)[source]¶

Returns an array with the “index” dimention as the firs dimention of the array.

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.finding_biggest_mode(PHI)[source]¶

Returns the index of the maximal value in a list

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.list_transpose(phi)[source]¶
Parameter:
phi: list with n-array matrices as elements.
Return:
phit: list with n-array transposed matrices of input parameter.
high_order_decomposition_method_functions.load(file_name)[source]¶

This function will load a file (variable, classe object, etc) in pickle format in to its python orinal variable format.

Parameters:

file_name: string type, containg the name of the file to load.

directory_path= is the adreess of the folder where the desired file is located. Returns

Variable: could be an python variable, class object, list, ndarray contained in the binary file.

Example

import high_order_decomposition_method_functions as hf

FF=hf.load(‘example_file’)

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.mass_matrices_creator(X)[source]¶

Returns a list of sparse diagonals matrices with the integration points for the trapezoidal integration method (mass matrices) from a list of cartesian grid points.

Parameter

X: list of Cartesian grids vectors.

Return M:list of mass matrices (integration points for trapeze integration method) as sparse.diag type elements.

Example import high_order_decomposition_method_functions as hf

import numpy as np

X1=np.array([ 0. , 0.25, 0.5 , 0.75, 1. ])

X2=np.array([ 0. , 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1. ])

X3=np.array([ 0. , 0.33333333, 0.66666667, 1. ])

X=[]

X.append(X1)

X.append(X2)

X.append(X3)

M=hf.mass_matrices_creator(X)

print(M)

[<5x5 sparse matrix of type ‘<class ‘numpy.float64’>’

with 5 stored elements (1 diagonals) in DIAgonal format>,

<6x6 sparse matrix of type ‘<class ‘numpy.float64’>’

with 6 stored elements (1 diagonals) in DIAgonal format>,

<4x4 sparse matrix of type ‘<class ‘numpy.float64’>’

with 4 stored elements (1 diagonals) in DIAgonal format>]

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.matricize(F, dim, i)[source]¶

Returns the tensor F rearanged as a matrix with the “i” dimention as the new principal (order 0) order. In other words it returns the unfolded tensor as a matrix with the “i” dimention as the new “0” dimention.

Parameters

F= array type of n dimentions.

dim= number of dimentions of the tensor F.

i= dimention that is going to be taken as the principal to matricize.

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.matricize_mass_matrix(dim, i, M)[source]¶

Returns the equivalent mass matrices of a matricized tensor.

Parameters

dim= number of dimentions of the problem.

i = dimension number to arange the function.

M= list of sparse.diag matrices as elements type with the mass integration (trapeze method integration points) for each dimention.

Return

\(M_{x}\) = The mass matrix as sparse.diag matrix with the integration points of the “i” dimention.

\(M_{t}\) = The equivalent mass matrix as sparse.diag matrix of n-1 dimentions.

Definition

Be \(M=(M_{1},M_{2}...,M_{i},..,M_{d})\) a list with \(M_{i}\) the mass sparse.diag matrix of each dimention.

Be “i” the dimention selected dimention to rearange the mass list

The result of the function will return:

\(M_{x}=M_{i}\)

\(M_{t}=M_{1} \otimes M_{2} \otimes...M_{i-1} \otimes M_{i+1} \otimes.. \otimes M_{d}\)

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.multilinear_multiplication(phi, F, dim)[source]¶

Parameters:_

phi= Is a list with n-array type elements as the elements.

F = 2d Array type (unfolded Tensor expresed as a matrix).

dim = tuple, list or array type that its value must be coherent with the number of elements of phi.

Return:_

W= Array type element, result of an unfolded multilinear multiplication.

Definition

In general the unfolding multilinear multiplication is given by:

\([(\phi_{1},\phi_{2},...,\phi_{n}).F]^{n}=\phi_{n}F^{n} (\phi_{1} \otimes ... \otimes \phi_{m-1} \otimes \phi_{m+1} \otimes ... \otimes \phi_{d})^{T}\)

where \(\otimes\) represents the Kronecker product.

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.new_forme_W(PHI)[source]¶

This function returns the shape as list of the core matrix in a tucker type decomposition.

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.orth(dim, Xgrid, R, C)[source]¶

This function serves to verify the orthogonality in L_{2} between the modes in the canonical class.

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.orthogonality_verification(w, R, RR)[source]¶

Auxiliar sub function of orth

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.rearrange(PHI, index)[source]¶

Given a list PHI and an index this function will return a new list with the “index” element of the list as the first element.

high_order_decomposition_method_functions.save(variable, file_name)[source]¶
This function will save a python variable (list, ndarray, classe

object, etc) in a pickle file format .

Parameters:

Variable= list, ndarray, class object etc.

file_name= String type. Name of the file that is going to be storage.

directory_path=string type. Is the directory adress if the file is going to be saved in a desired folder.

Returns:

File= Binary file that will reproduce the object class when reloaded.

Example

import high_order_decomposition_method_functions as hf

hf.save(F,’example_file’)

Binary file saved as’example_file’
